programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Rangers and Phillies end their three-game set. Texas used a nine-run fourth inning in the opener to win Jacob deGrom's debut, 11-7 over Philadelphia on March 30. Another Rangers debutant, Robbie Grossman, hit a three-run homer in the frame.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: Blood Line: The Life and Times of Brian Deegan
programme.desc: The life and career of motocross superstar, Brian Deegan, an X Games medallist and history's most decorated motorcross rider.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Golden Knights complete a back-to-back set by taking on the Predators. Vegas is 9-5-0 all-time versus Nashville after winning both prior meetings in 2022-23. Nashville hosts Carolina on April 6 before a crucial road trip to Calgary and Winnipeg.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Locked in a tight points battle, the Oilers and Kings end their season series. After allowing nine goals in the first two clashes, Edmonton clamped down for a 2-0 win over Los Angeles on March 30. Stuart Skinner (EDM) made 43 saves for the shutout.

programme.title: 2023 Masters Tournament
programme.desc: Ahead of the Masters, a varied field of Masters participants and noncompeting past champions wind their way around a short, nine-hole layout nestled in the northeast corner of the Augusta National grounds. Family members caddy for the golfers.

programme.title: Sportscenter at the Masters
programme.desc: Coverage and highlights surrounding the Masters Tournament.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulls clash with the Bucks. Chicago comes off a critical contest versus Atlanta, who the Bulls are jockeying with for the final two spots in the Eastern play-in tournament. Chicago can clinch a season-series triumph after winning twice in 2022.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Veteran broadcaster Michael Kay joins former slugger Alex Rodriguez to provide commentary on Sunday Night Baseball. Plus, discussion on fantasy baseball, predictive analytics and special guests tied to the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Houston Hoops House in Houston.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Men's college basketball action.

programme.desc: The players of the 2000 Baltimore Ravens come together to reflect on their legendary year of winning the Super Bowl.

programme.title: DC & RC
programme.desc: Former UFC two-division champion Daniel Cormier and former Super Bowl champion Ryan Clark talk about their shared love of MMA and the rest of the sports world.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Blackhawks' four-game homestand ends as they host the Devils. Vitek Vanecek made 24 stops and Dougie Hamilton figured in on each of New Jersey's goals in a 3-0 win over Chicago on Dec. 6, 2022. The Devils clinched a playoff spot March 25.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max
programme.desc: ‎Every morning, Keyshawn Johnson joins Jay Williams and Max Kellerman as they set the sports table for the day. From the games that electrified us the night before to the stories that will catch fire during the day, the guys will update and inform.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Road To The Masters Invitational
programme.desc: A cross-section of participants from the worlds of sports, entertainment, gaming and social media will convene in Augusta National's Press Building to play EA SPORTS PGA TOUR: Road to the Masters video game.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: From Pomona, Calif.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: From Detroit.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity calendar flips into April with the ToyotaCare 250. NASCAR veteran AJ Allmendinger dropped down to defend his Pit Boss 250 crown last week at Circuit of the Americas. Riley Herbst has six top-10 finishes in six starts this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series drivers run the SpeedyCash.com 250 at Texas Motor Speedway. Zane Smith recovered from a 20th-place finish in Atlanta to win his second race of 2023 at the Circuit of the Americas. Stewart Friesen won the 2022 edition.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Cup Series drivers contest the Toyota Owners 400 at Richmond Raceway. Tyler Reddick took his first checkered flag of the season March 26 in Texas. Martin Truex Jr. has three wins at this track since 2019. Denny Hamlin won this race last year.

programme.desc: Craig Carton brings his unique style to the day's biggest sports stories. Joined by guests and analysts, Carton will give the first perspective of the day on all the major topics.
